record1.<10>: * This record controls single sign on behavior
record1.<11>: * Set loginmode (field 1) , user groups ( fields 2,3, 4), local group flag (field 5) as needed
record1.<12>: * Save as CFG_LOGIN*MYAPP to make an application specific setting
record1.<13>: * Save as CFG_LOGIN to affect all applications in this copy of OpenInsight
record1.<19>: * <2> = LDAP (and/or local) Groups whose members are Normal users
record1.<20>: * <3> = LDAP (and/or local) Groups whose members are Admin users
record1.<21>: * <4> = LDAP (and/or local) Groups whose members are Sysadmin users
record1.<28>: * LoginMode = "0" (or "" or invalid) ==> use legacy authentication, require a username/password combination define in the OpenInsight application users list.
record1.<29>: * LoginMode = "1"         ==> get network user name, no password required, user name must exist in OpenInsight application users list.
record1.<30>: * LoginMode = "2"         ==> get network user name, no password required, user must be a member of a network group listed in config record <2>, <3>, or <4>
record1.<35>: * LocalGroupsFlag = "0" (or "" or invalid) ==> Only LDAP groups are checked for membership
record1.<36>: * LocalGroupsFlag = "1"         ==> Check LDAP groups for membership first, and if not found, check local groups
record1.<37>: * LocalGroupsFlag = "-1"        ==> Check local groups ONLY for membership (do not check LDAP groups)
record1.<42>: * The Login process will search for a record named CFG_LOGIN*appname, for example CFG_LOGIN*EXAMPLES
record1.<43>: * If that record does not exist OI will search for this record, CFG_LOGIN
record1.<44>: * If CFG_LOGIN does not exist OI will behave as if loginmode = 0
